column4: Hi I just installed the new version of ubuntu and when in terminal window I enter sudo it says that unable to resolve host......any ideas
I've heard of that error before.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/sudo/+bug/32906  It's a bug scheduled to be fixed...
It looks like you need to add 127.0.0.1 your-computer-name into /etc/hosts
absolutely confirm that typing 'sudo nano' does it not let you enter your password due to the hostname problem.
Let's try a few other oddball methods, even though none of them should work, apparently they worked for the bug testers at some point.
start aptitude from the terminal.  It recognises mouse input, use that to go to Actions -> Become root
You still have the root console open, right?
just enter the command nano      All the commands are with ^ being Ctrl
You'll need to make the edits anyways in the recovery console
Did the hostname command not work?
